body.p: George Mason University (GMU) is a public university located in Fairfax, Virginia, known for its innovative research and diverse programs.

section.title: Student Population
section.p: GMU serves approximately 39,000 students, making it the largest public university in Virginia by enrollment.

section.title: Popular Majors and Degrees
section.p: Popular majors include Information Technology, Business, and Psychology. GMU is also known for its strong Law and Economics programs.

section.title: Location
section.p: GMU’s main campus is in Fairfax, with additional campuses in Arlington and Prince William County.

section.title: Mascot
section.p: The mascot is "The Patriot," representing the GMU Patriots.

section.title: Additional Information
section.p: GMU is recognized for its diversity, innovation in technology, and its location near the nation’s capital.
